studyMetadata.title: Reviewing Communicating With Interactive Data Visualizations
studyMetadata.description: A study challenging participants to review linecharts.

uiConfig.studyEndMsg: **Thank you for completing the study. You may click this link and return to Prolific**: [https://app.prolific.com/submissions/complete?cc=C19P3VR0](https://app.prolific.com/submissions/complete?cc=C19P3VR0)

viral-a.instruction:
You will need to travel to **Eldoril North (Policy A)** for work.
You've come across this visualization and the accompanying caption.
Please review the visualization and the caption.

response.prompt: Do you trust this visualization and caption? What information in the visualization and caption led you to this decision? Please verbalize your answer.

viral-b.instruction:
You will need to travel to either **Silvoria or Mystara (Policy C)** for work.
You've come across this visualization and the accompanying caption.
Please review the visualization and the caption.

response.prompt: Do you trust this visualization and caption? What information in the visualization and caption led you to this decision? Please verbalize your answer.

Policies in Aerion have been put against low infection rates, but have been unsuccessful at stopping those cases from rising. Counter to this, policy in Mystara and Silvoria have managed to stem and reverse high rates of disease spread.
Despite similar peaks in infection rates, policy in Eldoril managed to bring them down more quickly and sharply than policy in Thundoril.

While gains in tech have been fairly steady, they have been relatively minor. Airlines provide volatility that more often than not trends downwards for long stretches of time. Gas has a similar trajectory, though it trends more consistently down. By comparison, the car industry has, through some volatility, managed to produce consistent gains over time.

Investment into this particular airline fund couldn't be better timed. While a decline from July through October left the price of investment lower than it is now, there is still an advantage to buying in this dip and allowing the expected rise to produce ample return on investment. By contrast, gas and car industry investments are showing a serious decline over time, with car investments producing below a -50% return.
